{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2503.24022v1", "title": "Wasserstein KL-divergence for Gaussian distributions", "summary": "We introduce a new version of the KL-divergence for Gaussian distributions
which is based on Wasserstein geometry and referred to as WKL-divergence. We
show that this version is consistent with the geometry of the sample space
${\Bbb R}^n$. In particular, we can evaluate the WKL-divergence of the Dirac
measures concentrated in two points which turns out to be proportional to the
squared distance between these points.", "main_category": "math.ST", "categories": "math.ST,stat.ML,stat.TH", "published": "2025-03-31T12:49:01Z"}
